intro: Eleocharis interstincta, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that bear small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown and are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. Eleocharis interstincta plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
